title: Subduction rupture threshold (synthetic Cascadia slow-slip checkpoints)
description: Synthetic sequence translating slow-slip stress accumulation ratios into rupture probability logistics for UTF tectonic rehearsals.

control_parameter.definition: stress accumulation ratio (current effective shear stress divided by critical failure stress)

order_parameter.definition: probability that a slow-slip episode cascades into seismic rupture

impedance.interpretation: Hydration-eased membranes reduce impedance as rupture probability rises beyond Theta, echoing pore-fluid lubrication.

ethics.considerations: Synthetic data for resilience research; not suitable for real-time warning decisions.
ethics.community_notes: Emphasise transparent communication with coastal and Indigenous communities when adapting the scenario.

literature: Scholz (2019) Mechanics of Earthquakes and Faulting
